thread.title: Colts 'hope and expect' Andrew Luck to start Thursday | NFL | Football | Sports
thread.title_full: Colts 'hope and expect' Andrew Luck to start Thursday | NFL | Football | Sports

author: torontosun.com
title: Colts 'hope and expect' Andrew Luck to start Thursday | NFL | Football | Sports
text:
The Indianapolis Colts "hope and expect" quarterback Andrew Luck will start Thursday night's game at Houston, NFL Network reported.
Tests revealed there's no structural damage in Luck's bruised right throwing shoulder, which sidelined him for Sunday's win against Jacksonville.
Matt Hasselbeck played in Luck's place.
DUNBAR DONE: Dallas Cowboys RB Lance Dunbar is out for the season after tearing both the ACL and MCL in his left knee, according to NFL Network. Dunbar suffered the injury on a kickoff return Sunday night at New Orleans. He had been an effective playmaker as a receiver out of the backfield.
REX BACKTRACKS: Buffalo head coach Rex Ryan changed his tune, a day after defiantly supporting his players after they came unglued late in a 24-10 loss to the Giants. Bills players were flagged for 17 penalties, including one personal foul and two unsportsmanlike conduct penalties by defenders in a six-play span.
After consulting coaches on his team and around the league, Ryan on Monday admitted the high penalty count actually is a big concern of his, that his players must toe the line better and cannot go "vigilante" if officials don't flag the other team for infractions.
Ryan added that he would consider briefly benching a player from now, if emotions and disappointment get the better of him and hurt the team by taking such 15-yard penalties.
EXTRA POINTS: LB Luke Kuechley remains in the concussion protocol, Panthers head coach Ron Rivera said ... Houston Texans head coach Bill O'Brien said Monday he is sticking with Ryan Mallett as his starting quarterback, despite his sub-par play. Before being yanked in the second half Sunday in Atlanta, Mallett completed just 44% of his passes for 150 yards. The Falcons led 42-0 at the time ... Terrelle Pryor had a tryout as a WR with San Francisco ... RB Ahmad Bradshaw tried out in Indianapolis ... Tampa Bay waived PK Kyle Brindza.
